subject_terms_3: war personalities Changi Prison 1942-1945 Japanese Occupation
physical_appearance: This is a christmas card. It is drawn on a gray pain paper in multicolored ink. The flap at the top features drawn mistletoe and written greetings. The picture at the bottom is ofa man, dressed in shorts, cooking over a fire. There is a small fold at the top right of the card. There are no tears seen.
sgcool_label_text: This pen and coloured ink Christmas card is from 1944. It depicts a Changi inmate at a camp fire. The card illustrates P.O.Wsâ€™ efforts in maintaining their spirits and traditions in spite of the conditions they lived in. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: A pen and coloured ink Christmas card for 1944, depicting a Changi inmate at a camp fire
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Christmas cards
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
